title: Slow Cooker Butter Chicken Recipe
description: This slow cooker butter chicken made with aromatic Indian spices in a rich and creamy curry sauce is easy to make for a restaurant-worthy meal at home!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Asian Indian Main Dishes Curry Slow Cooker Butter Chicken 4.5 (719) 517 Reviews 49 Photos It's easy to prep this butter chicken in the slow cooker in the morning to come home to the wonderful aroma of warm Indian spices... I love it and it's one of my favorite Indian dishes! Serve with basmati rice and warm naan bread. By The Meal Planner Updated on September 23, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 2 tablespoons butter 2 tablespoons vegetable oil 4 large skinless, boneless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces 1 onion, diced 3 cloves garlic, minced 1 (6 ounce) can tomato paste 1 tablespoon curry paste 2 teaspoons curry powder 2 teaspoons tandoori masala 1 teaspoon garam masala 15 green cardamom pods 1 (14 ounce) can coconut milk 1 cup low-fat plain yogurt salt to taste Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat butter and vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Stir in chicken, onion, and garlic. Cook and stir until onion has softened and turned translucent, about 10 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir in tomato paste, curry paste, curry powder, tandoori masala, and garam masala until no lumps of tomato paste remain. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Pour mixture into a slow cooker; stir in cardamom pods, coconut milk, and yogurt. Season with salt. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cook on High for 4 to 6 hours or Low for 6 to 8 hours, or until chicken is tender and sauce has reduced to the desired consistency. Remove and discard cardamom pods before serving. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cook’s Note Place the cardamon pods in a small mesh spice bag to make them easier to remove and prevent someone from biting into one while eating.
